info: The Modern Racism Scale was first published in 1983 by John B. McConahay with the intent to be "a non-reactive measure of anti-Black attitudes held by other ethnicities." While the scale "has been shown to strongly correlate with other measures of racism as well as discrimination," some of the questions are notably dated. This is most clear with the second question.

image_ex: This is an image of some of the Black Panthers at a demonstration in California on May 2, 1967. The Black Panthers are often depicted as the "violent approach" to combating racism in America. As a result, there is far more debate on the merits of the organization and their approach than those that practiced civil disobedience.
